title: Cédric Monod
text:
Cédric Monod (born 10 November 1974) is a Swiss former <a href="Pair%20skating">pair skater</a>. With his sister, <a href="Leslie%20Monod">Leslie Monod</a>, he is a three-time <a href="Swiss%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">Swiss national</a> champion (1992–94) and placed as high as sixth at the European Championships (<a href="1993%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1993</a>).
Personal life.
Born 10 November 1974 in <a href="Lausanne">Lausanne</a>, Cédric Monod is the elder brother of <a href="Leslie%20Monod">Leslie Monod</a>. He has three children – Ulysse, Louise, and Marcel.
A graduate of the <a href="University%20of%20Lausanne">University of Lausanne</a>, Monod taught for six years at Collège Arnold Reymond de Pully before joining Gymnase Auguste Piccard in 2006. He is a geography and physical education teacher.
Skating career.
After playing defense for an ice hockey team, Cédric Monod switched to figure skating, competing in <a href="single%20skating">singles</a> on the junior level and then <a href="pair%20skating">pairs</a> with his sister. They represented Switzerland internationally and CP Lausanne in domestic events. Their coaches included <a href="Heidemarie%20Steiner">Heidemarie Steiner</a> and <a href="Jacques%20Mrozek">Jacques Mrozek</a>.
The Monod siblings won the first of their three Swiss national titles in 1992. They finished 8th at the <a href="1992%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1992 European Championships</a> in <a href="Lausanne">Lausanne</a> and 12th at the <a href="1992%20World%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1992 World Championships</a> in <a href="Oakland%2C%20California">Oakland, California</a>. The following season, they placed sixth at the <a href="1993%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1993 European Championships</a> in <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a> and 9th at the <a href="1993%20World%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1993 World Championships</a> in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>. Their Worlds result allowed Switzerland to send two pair teams to the <a href="Figure%20skating%20at%20the%201994%20Winter%20Olympics">1994 Winter Olympics</a>.
In the 1993–94 season, the Monod siblings won their third national title but finished just out of the top ten, in 11th place, at the <a href="1994%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1994 European Championships</a> in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>. Following the Copenhagen result, the <a href="Swiss%20Olympic%20Association">Swiss Olympic Association</a> elected not to send them to the Olympics. The pair announced their competitive retirement on 3 February 1994.
Cédric Monod has worked as a skating coach, coaching <a href="Stephane%20Lambiel">Stephane Lambiel</a> from 2004 to 2005, and as a consultant for <a href="Radio%20T%C3%A9l%C3%A9vision%20Suisse">Radio Télévision Suisse</a>.
